page.title: 15Honeychurch
page.content: Honeychurch consisted of five farms in 1066 and these still exist today, with the same acreage.Their names are Bude;Westacott;Slade;Middletown and Eastown.Near the Old Rectory is Glebe Farm,a more recent addition formed from glebe land.If we take Middletown the nearest to the Chuch,as the Demesne Farm,then the 4 villeins in Domesday lived on Slade,Bude,Westacott and Eastown.The name of the Parish comes from Hunas'Church,the estate owner in the 10th.Century. The interior of the tiny church is unchanged from its original state.Wall painting can still be seen faintly. Apart from the Farms,there are no other buidings or amenities. Slade Farm contains carving similar to that in the church,perhaps as payment for board and lodging for the carver.
